feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 03 at 5:28AM AKDT until July 04 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Lightning Over Eastern Interior Today And Monday... .Red Flag Warnings for abundant lightning and extremely dry fuels remain in effect through midnight tonight for zones 218, 219, 220, 221, 222, 223, and 224. The Red Flag Warnings may need to be extended through Monday night. A thermal low pressure trough stretching from Northway to Bettles

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 5:24AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ANOTHER HEAT WAVE LIKELY LATE THIS HOLIDAY WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... Widespread hot temperatures are expected to develop again late this weekend across the Inner Channels with highs from the upper 70s into the 80s. Locations away from the water will be the warmest. Daily high temperature records will likely fall in some areas. At

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 12:08AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...The following area, Northern Inner Channels. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 9:56PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: As temperatures rise into the 80s through mid-week, the Taiya and other area rivers and streams are forecast to rise to bankfull conditions from rapid snowmelt in higher elevations through at least Wednesday. Hikers on the lower portion of the Chilkoot Trail should note that portions of the Chilkoot Trail could begin to inundate with water.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 1:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKDT TUESDAY JULY 5TH... This product is relayed from the Alaska Department of Environmental Conservation. ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION Division of Air Quality AIR QUALITY ADVISORY

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 10:27AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING FROM LAKE DRAINAGE NEAR NUIQSUT... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks, impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.

entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...The warm air temperatures in the upper 70s to around 80 degrees may cause people to underestimate the dangers of the cold water temperatures which are currently only in the 50s. * WHERE...Coastal Hancock and Coastal Washington Counties.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 8:45AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Madison and central Beaverhead Counties through 930 AM MDT... At 843 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles southwest of Dillon, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 10:20AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... Warm and very dry conditions expected over the holiday weekend. An upper-level system and dry cold front will bring gusty winds this afternoon and evening and again tomorrow. The winds, in combination with the warm and dry weather, will result in elevated fire weather conditions across much of the region.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:32AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today.
